sources.title: The Kid Brother (1927)
sources.description: I've been researching newly public domain films from 1929 and earlier, along with other pictures of the era that I find interesting, so I'm uploading the best possible copies that I can find. Regarded as possibly Harold Lloyd's best film, The Kid Brother was a commercial and critical hit upon release. Unfortunately it has mostly been forgotten since then except for the most dutiful of silent film fans. In the picture, Lloyd plays a weak and cowardly youngest sibling of a rough and tumble family. When a girl from a traveling medicine show attracts his attention, he has to learn how to be brave.Â

metadata.Plot: The most important family in Hickoryville is (naturally enough) the Hickorys, with sheriff Jim and his tough manly sons Leo and Olin. The timid youngest son, Harold, doesn't have the muscles to match up to them, so he has to use his wits to win the respect of his strong father and also the love of beautiful Mary.
